definition: to sing at the top of one's voice (idiom)

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

sentences.english: From the blind, I see Donald on his singing perch.
sentences.chinese: 透过百叶窗，我看到唐纳德在枝头引吭高歌。

sentences.english: Jara sang, his song a weapon in the hands of love.
sentences.chinese: 哈拉引吭高歌，是战斗的利器，紧握在爱之手。

sentences.english: Trumpeting heralds the start of the snow dance.
sentences.chinese: 它们引吭高歌宣告这场雪舞正式开始。

sentences.english: We spent countless hours around her piano singing.
sentences.chinese: 我们无数次围在她的钢琴旁边引吭高歌。

definition: to sing loudly/to lift one's voice in song
to crane one's neck/(fig.) with one's neck outstretched in expectation
to sing loudly/fig. to mouth slogans
to gather one's friends/to band together
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
high-pitched and penetrating (musical instrument, voice etc)/high-spirited/fever-pitched (atmosphere)
to spread one's wings and soar (idiom)/to develop one's abilities freely
to emit a sound/(of birds, insects etc) to chirp, hoot etc/(of a siren, steam whistle etc) to sound
